 Heh :)
 
 Oh man, only played single player??? You're in for a treat (or a brainwashing!)
 
 I did the SP game, had fun, then decided it might be fun to "try" the online play, having never played a FPS online before.
 
 That's when the trouble began. 
 
 I was intimidated at first, assuming I'd be a skilless fool amongst pros, but it really didn't take long. Maybe a few days, then learning each map, you're up to maybe 80% competence, and in my experience, having more fun in a short amount of time than any other game to date (!) that I've played. I played it on the PC, I'm not a big console fan, and I can't stand those funky controllers ;)
 
 In all seriousness, I returned it to a friend after 2 months and vowed never to load it again...until I retire early :) I would rate, very roughly, the online play as about 3x more enjoyable than the single player. The pull to play was amazing..hats off to them, they nailed it. The heart-pounding action of intense fights, with strategy, competition, and vehicles, quite a game. Nothing on the PC generates the kind of intense experience as player vs player. One warning though, the smack talk on the chats are outrageously profane. You can filter it I think, or ignore it, but just in case that's offensive or you have children...
 
 -Mach

Mach

Just curious, but what is the objective of the Halo games? Is it basically a clone of Quake and unreal type of games?

 
 Yes.
 
 However, they either got it right through long periods of testing, or through a combination of good fortune and testing. There is also significant usage/dependance on vehicles (Depending on the settings and map).
 
 I played some head to head (not online, just closed net) unreal, and quake. From my experience, there was no comparison. I can clearly make out my opponents, the movement isn't "jerky", and the maps work well. If that helps :)
 
 -Mach

 Reading your experience of Halo puts me in mind of mine with Planetside. The first multiplayer online first person shooter (MOFPS) it was a game that I could only describe as being excellent (although buggy). The battles are incredible- literally hundreds of players involved at a time with buggies, tanks, aircraft, infantry- you name it.
 
 Problem I found was that it was a time sink and sometimes just to engrossing to put down- the battles could last for hours over a single base sometimes.
 
 Amazing game, but after the beta testing and a couple of months retail play I had to bid it farewell. I think wifey has just about forgiven me now ;)
 
 Jaaaman: I don't know if you are into that sort of thing but it is very cool. If nothing else you would probably appreciate the Biblical nuances the story has.

I FOUND A TON OF GLICHES. 
 Fly across map:
 A.get a sword and a rocket launcher
 B.waste all your amo
 C.Put the rocket launcher cross air on an enemy.
 D.Press the right trigger and "Y" as fats as you can and at the same time.
 you have to keep the cross air on the enemy though.
 
 another way to "fly".
 A.get a sword and a warthhog.
 B.get in the passenger seat.
 C.have an enemy come up to you and put you sword cross air on him.
 D.When it turns red, pull the trigger to attack. You will a wierd sound.
 E.have you enemy go anywhere, he can even get into a banshee and fly around. 
 F.make sure you are looking at him the whole time. 
 G.get out of the wart hog and you will get a big suprise.
 
 "Bluff" with sword.
 when you pull the trigger and press X at the same time you will slash, but it will not hurt anybody.
 
 Getting on the skyscrapers on headlong.
 A.Turn on overshileds and damadge resistance.
 B.get a sword and rocket launcher.
 C.turn on wraiths.
 D.(this part is really hard to describe) you have to go to the wall inbetween two of the machine guns. these two turrets ar both located closer to the wall with the covenent vehicles. right under the turret clsoest to the cov vehicles is like dirt path then a short drop. go on the dirt "path". Walk inbetween the two Block structures. have the wraith go over right in front of you, then have it boost and hit straight or at an angle. because you ar pinned up against the wall, you will go up in the air really, really, REALLY, high. try and land on the lower crane so you can do the flying across the map trick and get your partner up there. then you can explore the top. I understand that this is very vague. I bet you'll find out a better way on another website.
